ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Be very afraid....
ygData.msgSnippet: Hehehe I just got my prod, but I fought him there, in the throne room area... over in the left corner... charmed his pet until that was dead, then realized i
ygData.messageBody:
Hehehe I just got my prod, but I fought him there, in the throne room
area... over in the left corner... charmed his pet until that was dead, then
realized i didnt have selo's up (had memmed charm in its place) so i mezzed
his ugly sarnak butt and memmed that then fought him til i was low in
health, messed him again, healed up, stuck chains on him when he tried to
run and killed him :) I'm not a great bard either, just konw with my
shaman I probably would have been toast!

But I agree Minkin, I seldom, if ever solo with Tani in a closed space. But
thats what I meant earlier about choosing your mobs and location carefully.




> -----Original Message-----
> From: Cyr, Thierry [mailto:thierry.cyr@...]
> Sent: Friday, August 24, 2001 7:53 AM
> To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Be very afraid....
>
>
> depends on the area Halana... I know in closed quarters I'd
> rather pull out
> my lower level necro then to use my bard, my bard got ganked 2-3 times
> getting my prod for HS key just cause I got lost on the way
> out of the maze
> (dumb dumb) and I couldnt go toe to toe with him or pull him
> out of the maze
> properly either, really irritating. After much aggravation I
> logged in my
> necro and went after him. The pet kept the whole room empty
> without losing
> any hp, when the named spawned I unloaded all my mana on it
> as I wanted
> payback for the aggravation he'd given me. I also had alot
> of fun there
> though with Antic (ya remember him dont ya) pulling as many
> as I could and
> He'd AE them, that was truly fun.
>
> But on a soloing front, I'd say outdoors bards are great,
> indoors I'd rather
> not even think about it untill I have more AC or my epic or something.
>
> Minkin
> 55 bard
> RIP
> A Ro
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Cranfill, Wendy [mailto:Wendy_Cranfill@...]
> Sent: August 23, 2001 6:15 PM
> To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Be very afraid....
>
>
> Hmm well I can see your point, and probably haven't noticed
> it because I
> haven't been on many raids with my bard. But the shammy
> getting exp on
> raids? *dies laughing*
>
> What I would like to see is raid platinum distribution
> myself. In a month
> of guild hunts, I've not seen a single pp... yet those rogues
> and rangers
> "give it all to the guild" - yeah, right.
>
> Everyone tells me that bards are bad at soloing, and that
> shaman are the
> best. I can solo 10 times better with my bard. Personally,
> I think its
> because people are very poor at picking out "soloable" areas and mobs.
> What a shaman can solo, a mage will crumple on, etc. I guess
> I tend to look
> at things like how long actual downtime is, the ability to
> handle multiple
> mobs and play with a variety of classees rather than just
> damage dealing.
>
> Kinda funny how things are on other servers and other guilds,
> SK's are like
> the joke of our guild. We have 1 SK and 1 Paladin lol!
>
> Tani/Halana
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: John Grady [mailto:john_grady@...]
> > Sent: Thursday, August 23, 2001 3:59 PM
> > To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: RE: [eqbards] Be very afraid....
> >
> >
> > I don't really agree. We are fairly weak at soloing and not
> very good
> > damage dealers in groups. More over, we are weak in raids.
> >
> > I agree with Aftathott on this one. Verant did a very good
> > job balancing
> > Bards in solo and group situations. But we are far less
> > valuable in raid
> > situations.
> >
> > Raids are one area VI should definitely spend some time on before
> > releasing Luclin. I hope they address XP in raids, class
> > balance in raids
> > and communication (chat) in raids.
> >
> > More and more of the game is around raids where the top
> > Warrior, Rogue,
> > Shammy, Chanter and Cleric take the XP. The 6th spot is very
> > likely a Monk
> > for pulling, but mages, wizzies and SKs are all more
> > preferred than Bards.
> >
> > Tzeetch
> > The Commune, Xegony
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > --- "Cranfill, Wendy" <Wendy_Cranfill@...> wrote:
> >
> > Ugh....
> >
> > Its funny... the more I play my bard and the higher she gets, I find
> > myself
> > sometimes not telling people everything I can do, kind of
> > keeping a low
> > profile, hoping that they don't notice. Seriously, don't
> > laugh, its just
> > that bards seem very overpowered to me at higher levels,
> then again 60
> > shaman with Can IV.... I used to think all level 60 were
> > equally powerful
> > but I'm changing my thoughts.
> >
> > I hope nobody else figures this out!
> >
> > Tani, 54 Bardette
> > Halana, 60 Shaman
> > Solusek Ro
> >
> >
